<<<<<<< HEAD
To the right honourable the Lords now assembled in Parliament. The humble petition of the high-sheriff, knights, esquiors, gentlemen, ministers, freeholders, and other the inhabitants of the county of Berks.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
March 5. London, Printed by Iohn Raworth, [London] : 1641 [i.e. 1642]
Also includes: To the honourable knights, citizens, and burgesses of the House of Commons now assembled in Parliament. The humble petition of the high-sheriff, knights, esquiors, gentlemen, ministers, freeholders, and other the inhabitants of the county of Berks. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
To the right honourable the Lords now assembled in Parliament. The humble petition of the high-sheriff, knights, esquiors, gentlemen, ministers, freeholders, and other the inhabitants of the county of Berks.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
March 5. London, Printed by Iohn Raworth, [London] : 1641 [i.e. 1642]
Also includes: To the honourable knights, citizens, and burgesses of the House of Commons now assembled in Parliament. The humble petition of the high-sheriff, knights, esquiors, gentlemen, ministers, freeholders, and other the inhabitants of the county of Berks. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Iohn Raworth
